author: Nery GreenWolf
comment: The tap control didn't work well but the motion one works great.

author: Dan Bischoff
comment: Easily the best game for Android Wear I've encountered yet.  The wrist motion control is fantastic!

author: Craig M
comment: The game is quite basic, but that's actually a benefit and not a fault. There is no other Android Wear game worth installing IMO.

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: There is a new update, please let us know whether you like the changes!

title: Fun

author: Mark Hogan
comment: Well done. Would be good with sound from the new watches with built in speaker's on next update
title: Great game.

author: christian lambert
comment: I open the app and check my apps but i dont see it?

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: Hi, this is for Android Wear watch (it is mentioned on title). For Gear S2 version, please download from Gear Apps store, part of your Gear Manager app on phone.

title: Ita not downloading to my gear s2?

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: A new version has arrived, hope you like it!

author: damian ryan
comment: This game was amazing. However the last update changed the controls from 'touch' to 'wrist'(tilt) control. I simply cannot play this way as my arm dosn't move enough to make it work. If there is an extra option to change controll from tilt to touch I will give 5 stars again...
title: I did love this game.....

author: Brian Jackowski
comment: Movement feels a little unresponsive, but that might be the watch (Moto 360)  Would love to see lives bumped up to 10 before 'game over'  Gaming on a wrist watch is so imprecise, it's nearly impossible to last more than two waves.  Edit - 1/30/2015 - Liking wrist control much better.  I can actually make it 3 rounds now, maybe more if I'm not distracted.

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: My kids can typically go to 3 waves or more. Give it a try... especially the new wrist control! Try controlling with 2 hands with wrist control, that might help. :)

title: Great time waster.

author: Eric Van DeMark
comment: I hope this game is never taken down because it's a great time waster. Runs smoothly on the Moto 360 :)

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: Thanks and appreciate the feedback! You can try our free Invaders or the 90s space arcade game Space War! Works for Moto 360!

title: Pretty sweet. Love this game and the watch face

author: Tom Gjonaj HeliGod
comment: Very fun , plays well on my sony smartwatch 3. Please add the ability to slide the spaceship with your finger rather than just tap to move.
title: Awesome

author: Lee Weaver
comment: This game is so addictive you will want to play it on tv!! This is one of the must have apps for android wear! The controls need the player to get a little bit of getting used to. You press the sides of the screen for the ship to go in that direction & keep on moving as well as firing. Press the middle bottom of the screen to stop moving/stay still & fire. Give the game a bit of a chance before reveiwing. If youre looking 4 something more mid90's shootemup try "space war (android wear)".

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback! We will look into the suggestions!

title: Leaves other wear games in the dust!

author: Jim Thibault
comment: Tap fires but can not move left or right at least very fast.  If I am in the middle tap right side of screen moves right, left move left but it is not very responsive.  No motion control that I see. (Sony Smartwatch 3)

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content: Hi, if you are using tap control (default), you can press the left of screen to move left, right of screen to move right. Centre to stay straight. Whenever you tap on the screen, it will fire. If you are using wrist control, just twist your wrist slightly will do (and it will auto-fire).

title: Can not figure out how to move right or  left

author: David Hixson
comment: On an Asus Zenwatch I've got almost no control over the side to side movement.  On the other hand, it is a game on a watch, which is a great idea.

reply.author: Virtual GS
reply.content:
Do you happened to use wrist control? With tap control, you press right side to right, left side to left, centre to stay... and shoot. Whenever you tap, you shoot.
If you are using wrist control, you can twist the watch to play the game. We have tested it under both square and round watches, and they should work.

title: Neat idea.. not done
